title: Risk dataset (Risk Data Library Schema)
description: A risk dataset described using metadata structured according to the [Risk Data Library Standard](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/).

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the dataset. Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the dataset.

risk_data_type.title: Risk data type
risk_data_type.description: The type of risk data included in the dataset, from the closed [risk data type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#risk-data-type).

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The entity responsible for making the dataset available.

version.title: Dataset version
version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of the dataset.

purpose.title: Dataset purpose
purpose.description: The purpose for which the dataset was created.

project.title: Project title
project.description: The name of the project that produced the dataset.

referenced_by.title: Referenced by
referenced_by.description: Related resources, such as publications, that reference, cite, or otherwise point to the dataset.

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area covered by the dataset.

license.title: License
license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the dataset, taken from the open [license codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#license). A Public Domain Dedication or [Open Definition Conformant](https://opendefinition.org/licenses/) license is recommended. Documents linked from this file may be under other license conditions.

contact_point.title: Contact point
contact_point.description: Contact information for the maintainer of the dataset.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: The entity responsible for producing the dataset.

attributions.title: Attributions
attributions.description: Information about entities and their roles in relation to the dataset.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Information about the resources included in the dataset.

hazard.title: Hazard dataset metadata
hazard.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe processes or phenomena that may cause loss of life, injury or other health impacts, property damage, social and economic disruption or environmental degradation.

event_sets.title: Event sets
event_sets.description: Information about sets of hazard events.

exposure.title: Exposure dataset metadata
exposure.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the situation of people, infrastructure, housing, production capacities and other tangible human assets located in hazard-prone areas.

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

taxonomy.title: Exposure taxonomy scheme
taxonomy.description: The name of the taxonomy scheme used to create descriptive individual asset feature strings within the dataset.

cost.title: Asset cost
cost.description: The exposure costs associated with specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability dataset metadata
vulnerability.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the physical fragility and vulnerability relationships in relation to specific hazards or combinations of individual hazards.

hazard_primary.title: Primary hazard type
hazard_primary.description: The primary hazard involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_type).

hazard_secondary.title: Secondary hazard type
hazard_secondary.description: The secondary hazard involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_type).

hazard_process_primary.title: Primary hazard process
hazard_process_primary.description: The primary hazard process involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_process_type).

hazard_process_secondary.title: Secondary hazard process
hazard_process_secondary.description: The secondary hazard process involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_process_type).

hazard_analysis_type.title: Hazard analysis type
hazard_analysis_type.description: The type of analysis applied to the hazard data used in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [analysis type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#analysis_type).

intensity.title: Hazard intensity measurement
intensity.description: The metric and units the hazard intensity measurement is given in, from the open [intensity measure codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#IMT).

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

cost.title: Asset cost
cost.description: The exposure costs associated with specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

taxonomy.title: Exposure taxonomy scheme
taxonomy.description: The name of the taxonomy scheme used to create descriptive individual asset feature strings within the dataset. Use of GED4ALL is recommended.

impact.title: Vulnerability impact
impact.description: The details of the vulnerability impact values produced in the modelled scenario(s).

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area to which the vulnerability function used in the modelled scenarios applies. `.scale` must be provided. Other fields may be provided if the spatial coverage of the vulnerability function differs from the coverage specified in the dataset-level `spatial` field.

functions.title: Impact functions
functions.description: Details of the functions used to calculate the vulnerability dataset.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability function
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

approach.title: Vulnerability function approach
approach.description: The approach the vulnerability function is based upon, taken from the closed [function approach codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#function_approach).

relationship.title: Vulnerability impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the vulnerability impact values, taken from the closed [relationship type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#relationship_type).

fragility.title: Fragility function
fragility.description: The fragility function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

approach.title: Fragility function approach
approach.description: The approach the fragility function is based upon, taken from the closed [function approach codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#function_approach).

relationship.title: Fragility impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the impact values, taken from the closed [relationship type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#relationship_type).

damage_scale_name.title: Damage scale name
damage_scale_name.description: The name of the damage scale used in the fragility function, taken from the open [damage scale name codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#damage_scale_name).

damage_states_names.title: Damage states names
damage_states_names.description: The names of the damage states listed in the fragility function.

damage_to_loss.title: Damage-to-loss function
damage_to_loss.description: The damage-to-loss function (or damage-to-loss model) used to calculate the impact of the hazard in conjunction with a fragility function.

approach.title: Damage-to-loss function approach
approach.description: The approach the damage-to-loss impact function is based upon, taken from the closed [function approach codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#function_approach).

relationship.title: Damage-to-loss impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the damage-to-loss impact values, taken from the closed [relationship type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#relationship_type).

damage_scale_name.title: Damage scale name
damage_scale_name.description: The name of the damage scale used in the damage-to-loss function, taken from the open [damage scale name codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#damage_scale_name).

damage_states_names.title: Damage states names
damage_states_names.description: The names of the damage states listed in a damage scale.

engineering_demand.title: Engineering demand function
engineering_demand.description: The engineering demand function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

parameter.title: Engineering demand parameter
parameter.description: The name of the engineering demand parameter, taken from the open [engineering demand parameter codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#engineering_demand_parameter).

approach.title: Engineering demand impact function approach
approach.description: The approach the engineering demand impact function is based upon, taken from the closed [function approach codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#function_approach).

relationship.title: Engineering demand impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the engineering impact values, taken from the closed [relationship type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#relationship_type).

analysis_details.title: Analysis details
analysis_details.description: Additional details about the analysis used to produce the vulnerability function used in the modelled scenario(s).

se_category.title: Socio-economic index category
se_category.description: The socio-economic category vulnerable to the hazard.

loss.title: Loss dataset metadata
loss.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the losses associated with people, infrastructure, housing, production capacities and other tangible human assets due to the occurrence of one or more hazards.

hazard_type.title: Hazard type
hazard_type.description: The main type of hazard involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_type).

hazard_process.title: Hazard process
hazard_process.description: The main hazard process involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_process_type).

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

cost.title: Asset cost
cost.description: The costs associated with the loss of specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

impact.title: Loss impact
impact.description: The details of the loss impact values produced in the modelled scenario(s).

type.title: Loss type
type.description: The type of loss described in the dataset, from the closed [loss type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#loss_type).

approach.title: Loss approach
approach.description: The approach the loss calculation function is based upon, taken from the closed [function approach codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#function_approach).

hazard_analysis_type.title: Event frequency type
hazard_analysis_type.description: The type of occurrence frequency represented in the modelled scenario, from the closed [analysis type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#loss_type).

hazard_id.title: Hazard dataset
hazard_id.description: A unique identifier for the hazard dataset used in the modelled scenario(s). Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

exposure_id.title: Exposure dataset
exposure_id.description: A unique identifier for the exposure dataset used in the modelled scenario(s). Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

vulnerability_id.title: Vulnerability dataset
vulnerability_id.description: A unique identifier for the vulnerability dataset used in the modelled scenario(s). Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: Sources of information that contribute to the creation of the dataset.

temporal_resolution.title: Temporal resolution
temporal_resolution.description: The minimum period of time resolvable in this dataset, in ISO8601 duration format.

links.title: Links
links.description: Links to related resources. The first item in the links array must be a link to the canonical JSON schema that describes the structure of the data.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: An individual file or other form of data. Resources can be fully informationally equivalent, such as CSV and JSON serializations of the same data. Resources can also have different levels of fidelity, such as a CSV file and a graphical representation of the data within the file. Resources can also differ in other aspects, such as the temporal coverage of each resource.

id.title: Resource identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this resource.

media_type.title: Media type
media_type.description: The media type of the resource, from the open [media_type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#media_type). For example a custom binary file has media_type 'application/octet-stream. A geojson file has the media_type 'application/geo+json'.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable description of the file format of the resource, taken from the open [data formats codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#data_formats).

spatial_resolution.title: Spatial resolution
spatial_resolution.description: The minimum spatial separation resolvable in this resource, measured in meters.

coordinate_system.title: Reference coordinate system
coordinate_system.description: The reference co-ordinate system of this resource, using the [EPSG codelist](https://epsg.org).

url.title: Url
url.description: The web address this resource can be downloaded from.

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this resource.

temporal_resolution.title: Temporal resolution
temporal_resolution.description: The minimum period of time resolvable in this resource, in ISO8601 duration format.

email.title: Email address
email.description: An email address for the entity.

url.title: URL
url.description: A URL associated with the entity.

Attribution.title: Attribution
Attribution.description: A qualified relation between an entity and a dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the attribution.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description: An entity with a role in relation to the dataset.

role.title: Role
role.description: The entity's role in relation to the dataset, using the open [roles codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#roles).

Related_resource.title: Related resource
Related_resource.description: A related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to a dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the related resource.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the resource.

authorNames.title: Author names
authorNames.description: The names of the authors of the resource.

datePublished.title: Publication date
datePublished.description: The date that the resource was first published.

url.title: URL
url.description: The uniform resource locator for the resource, e.g. the web address at which the resource can be accessed.

doi.title: Digital object identifier
doi.description: The digital object identifier for the resource.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: A source of information that contributes to the creation of a dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the source.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the source.

url.title: URL
url.description: The uniform resource locator for the source, e.g. the web address at which the source can be accessed.

type.title: type
type.description: The nature of the source, from the closed [source type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#source_type).

component.title: Component
component.description: The risk data component the source has been used in, from the closed [risk data type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#risk_data_type).

start.title: Start
start.description: The start of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

end.title: End date
end.description: The end of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the period in ISO 8601 duration format, e.g. 'P50Y' for 50 years

countries.title: Countries
countries.description: The countries covered by the geographical area, from the closed [country codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#country).

gazetteerEntries.title: Gazetteer entries
gazetteerEntries.description: Entries from geographical indices or directories describing the geographical area. This field should be used to describe sub-national coverage. Use of ISO 3166-2 is recommended.

bbox.title: Bounding box
bbox.description: A geographic bounding box delimiting the geographical area.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area.

centroid.title: Centroid
centroid.description: The coordinates of the centre of the geographical area.

scale.title: Spatial scale
scale.description: The spatial scale of the geographical area, from the closed [spatial scale codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#spatial_scale).

Gazetteer_entry.title: Gazetteer entry
Gazetteer_entry.description: An entry from a geographical index or directory describing a geographical area.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier drawn from the gazetteer identified in `.scheme`.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The gazetteer from which the entry is drawn, from the open [location gazetteers codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#location_gazetteers).

description.title: Description
description.description: A description for the gazetteer entry.

uri.title: Uniform resource locator
uri.description: A URI for the gazetteer entry.

Geometry.title: Geometry
Geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area.

type.title: Type
type.description: The GeoJSON geometry type that is described by `.coordinates`, from the closed [geometry_type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#geometry_type).

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: One or more GeoJSON positions according to the GeoJSON geometry type defined in `.type`.

Hazard.title: Hazard
Hazard.description: A phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other health impacts, property damage, social and economic disruption or environmental degradation.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this hazard.

type.title: Hazard type
type.description: The hazard type for this hazard, from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#hazard_type).

processes.title: Hazard processes
processes.description: The hazard process types for this hazard, from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#process_type).

intensity_measure.title: Intensity measure
intensity_measure.description: The metric and unit in which the intensity of this hazard is measured, from the open [intensity measure codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#IMT).

type.title: Hazard type
type.description: The hazard type for this hazard, from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#hazard_type).

processes.title: Hazard processes
processes.description: The hazard process types for this hazard, from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#process_type).

Event_set.title: Event set
Event_set.description: Information about a set of hazard events.

id.title: Event set identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event set.

hazards.title: Hazards
hazards.description: The hazards included in this event set.

analysis_type.title: Analysis type
analysis_type.description: The type of analysis used by the hazard model, from the closed [analysis type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#analysis_type).

frequency_distribution.title: Frequency distribution
frequency_distribution.description: The frequency distribution assumed for the occurrence of events over a multi-year timeline, from the [frequency distribution codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#frequency_distribution).

seasonality.title: Seasonality distribution
seasonality.description: The seasonality distribution assumed for the occurrence of events across a calendar year, from the [seasonality distribution codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#seasonality_distribution)

calculation_method.title: Calculation Method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event set in the modelled scenario(s), taken from the closed [data calculation type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#data_calculation_type).

event_count.title: Event count
event_count.description: The number of events contained in the event set. You should only use this field when details of individual events are not included in the RDLS metadata.

occurrence_range.title: Occurrence range
occurrence_range.description: A summary of the probabilistic occurrence scenarios that are included in the event set. You should only use this field when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area covered by the the hazard analysis in this event set.

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this event set.

events.title: Events
events.description: The events in this event set.

id.title: Event identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event.

disaster_identifier.title: Disaster identifier
disaster_identifier.description: The GLIDE number associated with this disaster event. A globally unique identifier for the event, assigned by [GLIDE](https://www.glidenumber.net/glide/public/search/search.jsp).

calculation_method.title: Model calculation method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [data calculation type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#data_calculation_type).

hazard.title: Hazard
hazard.description: The hazard to which this event relates.

occurrence.title: Occurrence
occurrence.description: The frequency or likelihood of the event happening within a given time frame.

probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be return period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

empirical.title: Empirical
empirical.description: The period of time over which the event occurred and the associated return period (if any). You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'empirical'

temporal.title: Temporal occurrence
temporal.description: The period of time over which the event occurred.

return_period.title: Associated return period
return_period.description: Probabilistic frequency estimate associated with the empirical events in terms of hazard intensity. Expressed as the denominator of '1/n', e.g. '10' for a 1-in-10 year return period etc.

deterministic.title: Deterministic frequency
deterministic.description: The index criteria and thresholds classification used by the deterministic event set, index approaches and susceptibility data. You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'deterministic'.

index_criteria.title: Index criteria
index_criteria.description: Full description of the approach and criteria used to produce the index value. A deterministic hazard intensity index (ranking, score, etc) is not tied to a specific occurrence probability, rather is produced using an aggregation criteria (e.g. max, mean, median of annual values over a period; multi-criteria combination; Principal Component Analysis; else).

thresholds.title: Index thresholds
thresholds.description: The thresholds used to classify the index value. Each threshold should be a separate item. Where thresholds are identified by both a number and a descriptor, include the descriptor in brackets, e.g. 1 (low).

description.title: Description
description.description: Provides additional information about this specific event

footprints.title: Footprints
footprints.description: The footprints for this event showing spatial distribution of hazard intensity.

Footprint.title: Footprint
Footprint.description: Information about a single hazard event footprint showing spatial distribution of hazard intensity.

id.title: Footprint identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this footprint

intensity_measure.title: Hazard intensity measurement
intensity_measure.description: The measurement unit used in the footprint, from the open [intensity measure codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#IMT). This is typically a measurement of intensity but can also take other forms, e.g. spectral velocity or flood water depth.

data_uncertainty.title: Data uncertainty
data_uncertainty.description: Details of the uncertainty of the footprint that should be taken into account when interpreting the data.

Cost.title: Asset cost
Cost.description: The costs associated with specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this cost.

type.title: Cost type
type.description: The type of the cost, from the closed [cost type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#cost_type).

unit.title: Cost unit
unit.description: The unit in which the cost is specified, from the closed [currency codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#currency).

Probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
Probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be return period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. This object must only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

return_period.title: Return period
return_period.description: The event return period (or recurrence interval); the estimated average time between events. Expressed as the denominator of '1/n', e.g. '10' for a 1-in-10 year return period etc.

event_rate.title: Event rate
event_rate.description: The average number of occurrences of the event within a given year. This is the reciprocal of the return period, related by event_set.frequency_distribution.

probability.title: Probability
probability.description: The likelihood of the event occurring in a given time period.

value.title: Probability value
value.description: The probability of the event occurring during the time period specified in `.span`, expressed as a number between 0 and 1, e.g. 0.1 represents a 10% likelihood of the event occurring.

span.title: Probability span
span.description: The length in years of the period in which the event is likely to occur with the probability specified in `.value`.

Impact.title: Impact
Impact.description: The details of the impact values produced in the modelled scenario(s).

type.title: Impact type
type.description: The type of impact calculated, taken from the closed [impact type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#impact_type).

metric.title: Impact metric
metric.description: The metric used to describe the impact, taken from the open [impact metric codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#impact_metric).

unit.title: Impact unit
unit.description: The unit the impact value is expressed in, taken from the open [impact unit codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#impact_unit).

base_data_type.title: Impact base data type
base_data_type.description: The type of data used to calculate the impact values, taken from the closed [data calculation type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#data_calculation_type).

Classification.title: Classification
Classification.description: A classification consists of at least two parts: an identifier for the list (scheme) from which the classification is taken, and an identifier for the category from that list being applied. It is useful to also publish a text label and/or URI that users can draw on to interpret the classification.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme or codelist from which the classification code is taken, using the open [classification_scheme](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#classification_scheme) codelist.

id.title: ID
id.description: The classification code taken from the scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the classification code.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to uniquely identify the classification code.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A link to a related resource.

href.title: Link target
href.description: The URL of this related resource.

rel.title: Link relation type
